business.headline: New income tax bill could hamper taxpayers' digital privacy. Details hereThe new bill gives tax officers the authority to access computers, emails, and social media accounts, raising privacy concerns.

M&M shares rise over 4% after UBS upgrade. 3 things investors should know M&M stock price: The brokerage said the recent 19% correction in M&M's share price, compared to Nifty Auto's 13% decline, was an overreaction to EV-related concerns.

Services sector growth accelerates in February backed by strong demandHSBC's final India services Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, rose to 59.0 in February from January's 26-month low of 56.5 but was lower than a preliminary estimate of 61.1.

What are reciprocal tariffs that Donald Trump mentioned in Congress address?US President Donald Trump announced the implementation of reciprocal tariffs starting next month while addressing a joint session of the US Congress.

Sensex surges 800 points. Why is the stock market rising today?Today's rebound has brought much-needed relief to traders on Dalal Street, reviving hopes of a broader recovery in the days ahead. Here's what's driving the rally and whether the downturn has bottomed out.

Explained: Why Coforge shares jumped nearly 10% todayCoforge share price: The stock reached an intraday high of Rs 7,924.50 in early trade and was up 8.65% to Rs 7,827.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:20 am.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back as IT stocks rally; investors remain waryThe Nifty IT index jumped nearly 2%, buoyed by a 10 % surge in Coforge after it signed a 13-year, $1.56 billion deal with Sabre Corp.

Struggling to find your old mutual fund investments? Let Sebi's Mitra help With over 7.5 million inactive folios across different asset management companies (AMCs), Mitra is designed to help investors recover their forgotten investments.
Does marriage impact your credit score? All you need to know While regular payments can improve both scores, any late or default on payments can considerably impact both the scores.

India's exports under pressure as US and EU tighten trade policiesUS President Donald Trump's plan to impose reciprocal tariffs from April is a major concern for Indian exporters, particularly in sectors like automobiles, agriculture, and manufacturing.

Nifty falls for 10th straight day, longest daily losing streak since 1996 launchNifty has registered a 10-day losing streak amid multiple triggers, including relentless selling by foreign investors and fears of an escalating trade war.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as trade war fears keep investors on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 96.01 points lower at 72,989.93 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 36.65 points to 22,082.65.

entertainment.headline: Sana Khan faces backlash after asking Sambhavna Seth to wear burqa for her podcastSana Khan found herself in the spotlight after a video of her asking Sambhavna Seth to wear a burqa went viral.

Aashram 3 Part 2: Aaditi Pohankar's Pammi outshines Bobby Deol's Baba NiralaAaditi Pohankar's character as Pammi has garnered her immense love and appreciation from fans. Her fierce portrayal and her quest to take revenge against Bobby Deol's Baba Nirala truly makes her the hero of the series.

Bobby Deol had a vertigo attack while promoting Aashram: Was very nervousActor Bobby Deol recently revealed that he suffered from a vertigo attack while promoting his popular show Aashram. The actor is currently seen in the latest season of the show, which is streaming on MX Player.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

Kanye West's wife Bianca goes nude again after controversial Grammy outingKanye West's wife Bianca Censori went nude for a photoshoot. This comes a month after her controversial 'nude' outfit at the Grammys.

Actor Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to divorce rumours: Dipika ne diya mujhe dhokhaTelevision couple, Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim have found themselves at the center of the separation rumours. The two addressed the same in their new vlog on YouTube.

Shonali Bose on DU, Miranda House's objection to Ziddi Girls: It was heartbreakingPrime Video's Ziddi Girls faced backlash from sections of Delhi University and Miranda House students over perceived negative portrayal, but director Shonali Bose clarifies the trailer was misunderstood and most students ultimately enjoyed the show.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.
Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

general news.headline: America is back: Trump touts tariffs, woke crackdown in joint Congress addressDonald Trump hailed sweeping policy shifts in a defiant address to a joint Congress session, touting aggressive foreign moves, trade disputes, and a crackdown on diversity programs as hallmarks of his administration's rapid transformation.

Kannada actor and top cop's daughter Ranya Rao arrested for smuggling goldKannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested at Bengaluru airport for allegedly smuggling 14.8 kg of gold worth Rs 12 crore from Dubai. Authorities are probing possible syndicate links and law enforcement involvement.

Steve Smith retires from ODIs after Australia crash out in semisChampions Trophy: Steve Smith has retired from ODIs after Australia failed to go through to the final of the mega event following the four-wicket loss to India on Tuesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

You want war, you'll have it: China's stern message to Trump over tariffsDonald Trump has accused China of failing to stop the export of chemicals used in the production of opioid fentanyl to justify the imposition of tariffs on Chinese goods.

Where's the drama? India's Champions Trophy run is like a spoilerThe Champions Trophy feels like a whodunnit in reverse -- its ending obvious from the start, with India crushing Australia in a lopsided semi-final. Every time Australia dared to dream, India punched them in the face, and didn't let the game stray from its inevitable ending.

Arvind Kejriwal in Punjab for Vipassana, slammed for convoy: Bigger than Trump'sAccompanied by the massive convoy, which included more than 100 Punjab Police personnel and bulletproof vehicles, Arvind Kejriwal and his wife Sunita arrived in Punjab late Tuesday night. The couple will attend the meditation camp from Wednesday.

Trump vows reciprocal tariffs against India, China from April 2: We'll tax themDonald Trump's pledge for reciprocal tariffs came a day after his new 25 per cent tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports took effect, along with a doubling of duties on Chinese goods to 20 per cent. As a result, the three countries have announced retaliatory measures against the US.

Abu Azmi suspended from Maharashtra Assembly amid row over Aurangzeb remarkAbu Azmi, a four-time MLA, triggered a political storm after he criticised the portrayal of historical events in the movie 'Chhava' and praised Aurangzeb as a good administrator.

Watch: Trump backs Melania's anti-revenge porn bill, jokes about using it himselfPresident Donald Trump endorsed First Lady Melania Trump's advocacy for a federal revenge porn law but drew mixed reactions after joking about invoking the protections himself against online criticism.

With one single at a time, the batting great is further cementing his reputation as one of the greatest chasters in one-day cricket.

He's going to do a great job: Trump praises FBI's Kash Patel in Congress speechUS President Donald Trump praised FBI Director Kash Patel during his first joint address to Congress, crediting him with restoring trust in a "weaponised" justice system.

Micro-retirement is cool, but how to know if you can afford it?Before informing your HR manager about your retirement plans (even if it's a micro-retirement), you need to have a few things in place - most importantly, your finances.

Amid fat-shaming row, Congress leader's climbdown after India defeat AustraliaCongress leader Shama Mohamed, who courted a massive controversy by fat-shaming Rohit Sharma, congratulated Team India for defeating Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy in Dubai under his captaincy.

Trump appoints 13-year-old cancer survivor as Secret Service agent, youngest everIn a touching moment during his first joint session address, US President Donald Trump made 13-year-old DJ Daniel, a Texas boy battling cancer since 2018, an honorary Secret Service agent.

Five reasons why South India is resisting the 'North' pushThe divisions are seen to have only deepened under BJP-led central rule, prompting a fierce confrontation and counter from Opposition-ruled southern states

Donald Trump warns of rising autism cases in the US: What's behind it?In his speech, addressing Congress, President Donald Trump highlighted a sharp rise in autism cases in the US, suggesting it may be an epidemic. Currently, one in 36 children is affected by the disorder.

Inside Karan Johar, Nora Fatehi's glamorous night at Oscars after-partyKaran Johar and Nora Fatehi attended the Oscars after-party in Beverly Hills. Lilly Singh shared glimpses from the Vanity Fair bash, where Nora stunned in gold and KJo posed with global stars.

What more can I do? KL Rahul hits back at trolls after knock vs AustraliaIndia batter KL Rahul hit back at trolls for constantly questioning his position in the ODI team. KL Rahul's comments came after the batter took India over the line in the semi-final against Australia.

Don't talk revenge, just enjoy the sport: Gavaskar on India beating AustraliaChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar said India were the better team against a hamstrung Australian side in the semi-final on Sunday. The former captain lauded Virat Kohli's responsible 84, calling him one of the greatest chasers in ODI history.

Winning tosses or matches? Rohit Sharma has a favouriteRohit Sharma's luck at the toss continues to falter as he lost his 11th consecutive toss in India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia. With an unwanted record looming, does it really impact India's chances?

Virat Kohli the greatest among greats in ODI run chases: Kapil Dev Champions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Kapil Dev said Virat Kohli is a cut above the rest when it comes to ODI run-chases. Kohli hit a well-paced 84 as India knocked Australia out of the tournament in Dubai on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli on missing semis hundred: Wins matter, not milestonesChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli missed out on a well-deserved hundred by 16 runs, but the former captain played a key role in helping India outclass Australia in Dubai. Kohli said he is no longer particular about milestones and landmarks.

Chase master Virat Kohli fires India into final, sends Australia home Champions Trophy 2025, India vs Australia semifinal: Virat Kohli came up with a solid batting display as India registered a record chase to beat Australia. The Men in Blue qualified for the final of the Champions Trophy for the third successive time.

Kohli emulates Sachin Tendulkar after 8,000 runs in ODI chasesVirat Kohli joins Sachin Tendulkar as only the second batter to cross 8000 runs in ODI run-chases, reinforcing his reputation as India's ultimate chase master after anchoring the Champions Trophy semi-final win over Australia.

SA vs NZ, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingSouth Africa and New Zealand are all set to lock horns in the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Both teams will carry their rich form into the all-important clash.

Watch: Head celebrates Rohit's wicket after captain flops in semisIndia vs Australia, Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma failed to make use of two extra opportunities in India's run chase of 264. The captain was dismissed for 28 in the 8th over as Australia got their man despite putting him down twice.

India loss hurts, but need to be patient: Pakistan coach JavedAaqib Javed urged patience amid Pakistan's struggles, stressing that frequent coaching changes and lack of stability are hindering progress. He emphasised stability, even as the repeated defeats to India continue to frustrate fans after their Champions Trophy group-stage exit.

Shubman Gill follows Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli's footsteps with MRF dealIndia batter Shubman Gill has signed a deal with renowned Tyre brand MRF as his bat sponsor. He joins an elite club of players such as Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli and Brian Lara.

Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be turning point: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa feels that Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be the turning point in the India vs Australia semi-final in the Champions Trophy 2025. Shreyas pulled off the stunning effort in the 48th over.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
